#ptchat Goodnight everyone. And thanks for a great chat! Many Qs/comments to digest. Hopefully this was helpful!
#ptchat We do them a disservice if we try to convince them that the world is meritocratic or that they win if they just focus on themselves.
#ptchat We need them to imagine new ways to connect & rebuild our societal fabric.
#ptchat And keep in mind.. This cohort is going to face increasing levels of class inequality among them. They feel it, it's stressing them.
#ptchat This is where both parents & teachers are needed. As guides. As interlocutors. As mentors. As parents & teachers who care.
#ptchat But when it comes to tech, don't lecture. "Back when I was your age" won't fly. And it's disrespectful of where they're at.
#ptchat Invite students to reflect on the world around them. Ask hard questions. Teach through example.
#ptchat They turn to technology to develop their sense of the social world. Don't formalize this as "educational" in the classic sense
#ptchat Expect students to be teens first, students second. They want to learn about sociality before they learn maths.
#ptchat I've watched the worst teen-to-teen sex-ed take place through Facebook, in an era of abstinence-only education.  :(
#ptchat And so, when it comes to the internet, teens learn from their peers. This is both good. And horrifying.
#ptchat But I feel really bad for educators. They're in a tough spot. In every way. Many do the best they can w/ limited resources/support.
#ptchat I so wish that schools would empower educators to help students learn, not simply "teach."
#ptchat This is uber sad to me. Educators have so much to teach youth. Learning would be so enhanced by not having false divisions.
#ptchat Today, school fear-mongering is so pervasive that teachers are told that they should never interact w/ youth online.
#ptchat In the early days of social media, educators were present there, helping students be whole people.
#ptchat Educators play a critical role in kids' lives and that role isn't just them standing up in the classroom.
#ptchat Most educators went into the profession because they love teaching. They want to help youth. And then they get their hands tied.
#ptchat Hard tradeoff. We can imagine everything that can go wrong, but if we don't give kids freedom, they don't get to benefit either.
#ptchat Teens aren't better off by being isolated more. Most adults gain more by living down our past than by not having one.
#ptchat But our cultural "big data" problems don't get solved by further marginalizing teens.
#ptchat What worries me about "big data" is the potential for discrimination, for judgments based on data taken out of context.
#ptchat They are indeed building digital footprints. We all are. And those who are more privileged will get to live down their mistakes.
#ptchat Teens ingenuity when it comes to privacy really inspired me. It made me realize how resilient most teens are.
#ptchat This is a reasonable response to surveillance. Surveillance == assertion of power over someone through observation.
#ptchat So you can see what they've posted, but you have no idea what it means. That's the point. That's social steganography.
#ptchat So they encode content, focusing more on restricting access to meaning in lieu of restricting access to content.
#ptchat Recognize - teens want to be *IN* public, but that doesn't mean they want to *BE* public. Not everything is mean for posterity
#ptchat Over last decade, teens have started encoding their content more. They're hiding in plain sight cuz adult are watching.
#ptchat Let's be honest: we're boring. We're not trying to work out our identities in the same way. Our relationships are more solidified.
#ptchat Just as my social media feeds are filled with baby photos (oh, the future is going to be ugly), theirs are filled with social stuff
#ptchat The contours of their tech use are very much shaped by their peers, by their lifestage.
#ptchat Teens look to tech for all that they have to gain. Adults look at what they have to lose.
#ptchat Teens are trying to figure out their place in this world. They turn to social media to hang out, socialize, flirt, gossip, ...
#ptchat We adults are far too mean & cruel for sport. Our news, our politics, our entertainment. And then we tell youth to not be cruel!?!?
#ptchat As adults, we need to admit fallibility when it comes to being ideal citizens. Teens see our hypocrisy.
#ptchat And that gets us to an understanding of the broader world and your part in it. How do you create the world you want to live in?
#ptchat The third tenet is to engender curiosity, to ask questions, to learn. Critical thinking is key here.
#ptchat The second tenet has to do with recognizing others. Respect, appreciation, tolerance, love. Social-emotional learning.
#ptchat (It's important to distinguish between boogeyman and real safety risks.)
#ptchat The first key tenant is to be able to assess one's own safety & get help when one's not safe.
#ptchat In my mind, citizenship is citizenship, digital or not. The core tenants simply become amplified. Separating digital doesn't help
#ptchat @CappiesCorner @rachelfkane We all need to appreciate being present, but teens are often more present than adults. <grin>
@nobleknits2 Explain
#ptchat @GetMetaMoo Helping can be listening, pointing to social services, developing social skills.. And much more.
#ptchat @TedHiff It's all about networks. The divisions are structural, embedded in the graph. That's what makes it hard.
#ptchat There's a diff between "helicoptering" & what Jacobs calls "eyes on the street". The former is surveillance. The latter is love.
#ptchat You will help your child more if you focus on helping her/his friends who are struggling. Divorce, stress, .. or worse.
#ptchat All of our kids are better when other kids are taken care of. Network effects are everything. Peer dynamics are huge.
#ptchat For y'all who are listening, focus less on your kids & more on those in your community. We need to build a strong societal fabric
#ptchat Plenty of teens are crying out for help online. They make their pain visible. But far too caring adults are paying attn to that
#ptchat We live in an individual-centric society. So we pay attention to *our* kids, w/o looking out for others who are hurting
#ptchat Part of my frustration is that we pay attention to privileged, well-supported kids. And ignore those who don't have support.
#ptchat This doesn't mean all kids are doing OK or that we should ignore those who are struggling.
#ptchat It's hard to learn in a bubble. This is why teens need freedom, as discomforting as it is for us parents/teachers.
#ptchat Teens need to be taught to be critical of their environments, to assess risk, to learn from their mistakes.
#ptchat The teen years are a transition, from childhood to adulthood. Teens need help making that transition, but help != paternalism.
#ptchat Adults need to slowly give youth freedom, online & off. Be present, be engaged, but let them take risks & learn.
#ptchat They go online, not because they love the internet, but because it gives them freedom they don't otherwise have. It's a relief valve
#ptchat And we somehow expect magic fairy dust to come down at age 18 (or 25) and create informed, engaged adults.
#ptchat We want them to care about civic life, but we don't let them take part in it.
#ptchat We want them to stand/fight for freedom, but we don't give them any.
#ptchat And then we expect them to find independence, self-confidence in the ether.
#ptchat Teens' mobility has been heavily restricted cuz we fear teens & we fear for them. So we "protect" them by removing freedom.
#ptchat Since 80s: 24/7 news fear-mongering. Curfew/trespassing/loitering laws. Fear of "latchkey" kids. Suburbanization.
#ptchat Their reasons are nuanced but they point to significant changes in American society in last 30 years.
#ptchat Over & over, teens told me that they'd much prefer to be w/ friends in person (w/out adult surveillance), but they couldn't.
#ptchat @saschasegan We were geeks/freaks/queers. Outsiders. This is mainstream, complete w/ all mainstream practices - good, bad, ugly.
#ptchat @cybraryman1 - that's not not just teens; that's adults. Teens ignore phones when allowed to hang out w/ friends (w/o adults)
#ptchat Part of the story is that there's a lot of fear about technology, fear about teens. Put the two together and OMG anxiety!
#ptchat So the reason I wrote the book was to help adults appreciate teens' lives. To appreciate what they're doing & not doing.. and why.
#ptchat After spending years learning from teens, I realized that I couldn't just sit back & watch as people misunderstood them.
#ptchat I expected to see really radical transformations. What surprised me the most was how little about teen life had changed.
#ptchat When I started this project, I wanted to understand what happened once technology was mainstream, once it wasn't just us geeks...
#ptchat I spent my teen years talking to strangers, before it was seen as "dangerous." Back then, using a computer was "educational" <g>
#ptchat I was among the 1st gen of teens to grow up online. For me, it was a saving grace. It allowed me to interact w/ a bigger world
@JoyWright91 @TedHiff <grin> yay!
